results.content: Short, little introductory course. Incredibly simple and well explained. It contains everything one needs to start building a website (just the css) but i understand it links to HTML and other curses which build on this. results.content: This is a course that is a quick once over of some of the basic CSS concepts. It isn't really something for a complete beginner. I think it is designed for someone who has some knowledge of CSS.  The instruction isn't in depth and just touches the surface of the topic, but it is well presented and fun to take. It also presents some basic tips that are helpful. I enjoyed it.
results.content_html: This is a course that is a quick once over of some of the basic CSS concepts. It isn't really something for a complete beginner. I think it is designed for someone who has some knowledge of CSS. The instruction isn't in depth and just touches the surface of the topic, but it is well presented and fun to take. It also presents some basic tips that are helpful. I enjoyed it.

results.content: This course is great to cover the basics of css and get you started before you dive into more complicated css tutorials.
results.content_html: This course is great to cover the basics of css and get you started before you dive into more complicated css tutorials.

results.content: You get to know about CSS basic stuff in this one hour. This introduction is sufficient to begin learning a html course and you can easily learn CSS along the way without spending much time in dedicated CSS course(Time consume one).

results.content:
This is very good course for beginners to understand the basics of CSS changes. Its explained in details. 
If you are looking for some advance details please look for the topics in your course.
results.content_html:
This is very good course for beginners to understand the basics of CSS changes. Its explained in details.
If you are looking for some advance details please look for the topics in your course.

results.content: I took this as a refresher to CSS. The course was broken up into very user friendly bite-size tutorials which explained and demonstrated the basics of CSS. My only feedback is that sometimes the cursor was left hanging over the screen, mildly distracting. Definitely recommend taking this if you're new to CSS or want to refresh after many years of not using it. Added bonus of linking to JS Bin for the tutorials, easy to use and play around with the coding from each session.
results.content_html: I took this as a refresher to CSS. The course was broken up into very user friendly bite-size tutorials which explained and demonstrated the basics of CSS. My only feedback is that sometimes the cursor was left hanging over the screen, mildly distracting. Definitely recommend taking this if you're new to CSS or want to refresh after many years of not using it. Added bonus of linking to JS Bin for the tutorials, easy to use and play around with the coding from each session.

results.content: As someone who has zero knowledge, I believe this is a great course considering the short duration of it. Pretty much easy to understand everything.
results.content_html: As someone who has zero knowledge, I believe this is a great course considering the short duration of it. Pretty much easy to understand everything.

results.content: This was a very good course.  I am happy that I was able to learn a little about HTML and CSS at the same time.  Some things got over my head like unordered list/ordered list and tables, but I will take the class again so I can really get it.  I like the teacher's simple approach and enthusiasm.  He speaks clearly and you can see exactly what he's doing and the outcome.  Thank you.
results.content_html: This was a very good course. I am happy that I was able to learn a little about HTML and CSS at the same time. Some things got over my head like unordered list/ordered list and tables, but I will take the class again so I can really get it. I like the teacher's simple approach and enthusiasm. He speaks clearly and you can see exactly what he's doing and the outcome. Thank you.

results.content:
This is ok but more like a you tube vid than a proper learning programme. You are expected to write code while you watch which is near impossible so you have to keep stop / starting the videos as there are no additional resources to refer to or dedicated interludes to practice. So this isn't really an hour long at all. It takes much longer. 
The explanations aren't always clear and most of the tutorials are simply watching the tutor doing stuff on a screen and jumping back and forth. He doesn't appear to have prepared a clear script or lesson before hand so it can become hard to follow and confusing in places.
HOWEVER, I did come out of the course knowing much more than I did before. I can write very basic HTML & CSS so I'm happy about that and found it useful. This course is probably good for anyone with a bit of existing background knowledge wanting a fast intro to CSS.
results.content_html:
This is ok but more like a you tube vid than a proper learning programme. You are expected to write code while you watch which is near impossible so you have to keep stop / starting the videos as there are no additional resources to refer to or dedicated interludes to practice. So this isn't really an hour long at all. It takes much longer.
The explanations aren't always clear and most of the tutorials are simply watching the tutor doing stuff on a screen and jumping back and forth. He doesn't appear to have prepared a clear script or lesson before hand so it can become hard to follow and confusing in places.
HOWEVER, I did come out of the course knowing much more than I did before. I can write very basic HTML & CSS so I'm happy about that and found it useful. This course is probably good for anyone with a bit of existing background knowledge wanting a fast intro to CSS.

results.content:
Una buena introducción al uso de CSS, pero me han sobrado ejemplos repetitivos y, sobre todo, los errores de escritura y vuelta a escribir que se reproducen demasiadas veces en el video. Igual que los momentos en los que no sabe que decir y que alargan el tiempo de reproducción.

Preferiría que hubiera aprovechado ese tiempo en poner ejemplos diferentes o en hacer una secuencia de modificaciones cada vez más amplia, no repitiendo los mismo ejemplos muchas veces desde 0.
results.content_html:
Una buena introducción al uso de CSS, pero me han sobrado ejemplos repetitivos y, sobre todo, los errores de escritura y vuelta a escribir que se reproducen demasiadas veces en el video. Igual que los momentos en los que no sabe que decir y que alargan el tiempo de reproducción.

Preferiría que hubiera aprovechado ese tiempo en poner ejemplos diferentes o en hacer una secuencia de modificaciones cada vez más amplia, no repitiendo los mismo ejemplos muchas veces desde 0.

results.content: As a beginner with very limited knowledge, it was great. Pace is good. Instructor is very clear. As the instructor states, code along as you watch.
results.content_html: As a beginner with very limited knowledge, it was great. Pace is good. Instructor is very clear. As the instructor states, code along as you watch.

results.content: This was a little confusing on the CSS becuase I couldn't type as fast as he spoke, and I couldn't always tell when he switched screens. It would be good if he gave you a 10 second pause or said pause now and type this in, because if practice is how you learn, then you need to type what he's typing and I wasn't always sure when to pause, so I wound up going back over a lot of content to pause where he did and figure out what screen he was on.  The HTML and CSS backgrounds look the same, so you can easily wind up typing on the wrong page.  One thing that is not clear is why you type it on the HTML page, and then copy it to CSS instead of just typing on CSS Page.  What is the benefit of using CSS if the same exact steps are on the HTML page and do the exact same thing?  This was not hard, and I'm gaining confidence. I knew more than I thought, but to become a full-stack web dev. will require far more than introductory. This was a great introduction and I don't think the next course will be as daunting.
results.content_html: This was a little confusing on the CSS becuase I couldn't type as fast as he spoke, and I couldn't always tell when he switched screens. It would be good if he gave you a 10 second pause or said pause now and type this in, because if practice is how you learn, then you need to type what he's typing and I wasn't always sure when to pause, so I wound up going back over a lot of content to pause where he did and figure out what screen he was on. The HTML and CSS backgrounds look the same, so you can easily wind up typing on the wrong page. One thing that is not clear is why you type it on the HTML page, and then copy it to CSS instead of just typing on CSS Page. What is the benefit of using CSS if the same exact steps are on the HTML page and do the exact same thing? This was not hard, and I'm gaining confidence. I knew more than I thought, but to become a full-stack web dev. will require far more than introductory. This was a great introduction and I don't think the next course will be as daunting.

results.content: CSS registered for me when he explained it like a programming language - in particular - C, and how CSS is like a style-function. So now I already have a better understanding of CSS.
results.content_html: CSS registered for me when he explained it like a programming language - in particular - C, and how CSS is like a style-function. So now I already have a better understanding of CSS.

results.content:
I think it covers the basic very well.
One of the topic is little misleading thought, "Class vs ID". I was hoping for something like which one takes precedence when both are used in a tag, why class should be used instead of ID (what you said about ID applies to class also), etc.

Overall, a good introduction course. Thanks.

Overall, a good introduction course. Thanks.

results.content: It was a good match, I learned a little bit more than I already had in my tool kit especially in regards to multiple styles being contained in the same CSS.  Thanks.

results.content:
Good, very basic, as expected. Still, a few more words on why you do things in certain ways (such as separation of concerns) would help people get a better picture.
Just playing around with programming only gets you  so far. To become good at it you need to understand more of the concepts, the general lessons learned over the decades. Even a basic course such as this could hint at some of this, maybe at the expense of changing a color to maroon for the fifth time.
results.content_html:
Good, very basic, as expected. Still, a few more words on why you do things in certain ways (such as separation of concerns) would help people get a better picture.
Just playing around with programming only gets you so far. To become good at it you need to understand more of the concepts, the general lessons learned over the decades. Even a basic course such as this could hint at some of this, maybe at the expense of changing a color to maroon for the fifth time.

results.content: The course is pretty good if you already know the basics of HTML and CSS and you want to refresh your knowledge. If you are completely beginner you will be lost. The audio and video are fine too.

results.content: As always, your classes are among the best. This is a great course for someone who has no CSS knowledge and will get them going in the right direction! Have loved every one of your classes! Keep up the great job!
results.content_html: As always, your classes are among the best. This is a great course for someone who has no CSS knowledge and will get them going in the right direction! Have loved every one of your classes! Keep up the great job!

results.content:
I feel the speaker wasn't very comfortable with explaining concepts and going through the examples.  A lot of ums, ok, uhs.  Just kind of someone that sounds awkward to talk to.   

Secondly it seems like the course is just throwing a lot of examples together at me, nothing is really tying it all together or connecting the dots if you will.  

Unless you've never heard of CSS before, you will probably not need to take this course or get much from it
results.content_html:
I feel the speaker wasn't very comfortable with explaining concepts and going through the examples. A lot of ums, ok, uhs. Just kind of someone that sounds awkward to talk to.

Secondly it seems like the course is just throwing a lot of examples together at me, nothing is really tying it all together or connecting the dots if you will.

Unless you've never heard of CSS before, you will probably not need to take this course or get much from it

results.content:
John is my favourite lecturer on Udemy and has a way of making learning fun. His passion comes through in his videos. This another fun course for CSS beginners.

The only drawback would be if you are looking for a more in-depth course (which most developers would eventually).
results.content_html:
John is my favourite lecturer on Udemy and has a way of making learning fun. His passion comes through in his videos. This another fun course for CSS beginners.

The only drawback would be if you are looking for a more in-depth course (which most developers would eventually).

results.content:
First of all, I'd like to thank you for the knowledge and learning sessions. I know making an hour course isn't easy, but, IMHO, after I finished the course, there some points that would be better to be improved.

- try to be more focus about the topic content.
- AFAIK, the box-model [margin, border, padding] is one of the important things to be understood in learning CSS, and also about the layout, such as 'float' and 'position' properties.

For you as an instructor, IMHO, it'd be better to minimize the personal-preference-stuffs ^_^ try to be more focus about the course content.

*** keep on learning, keep on developing ***
results.content_html:
First of all, I'd like to thank you for the knowledge and learning sessions. I know making an hour course isn't easy, but, IMHO, after I finished the course, there some points that would be better to be improved.

- try to be more focus about the topic content.
- AFAIK, the box-model [margin, border, padding] is one of the important things to be understood in learning CSS, and also about the layout, such as 'float' and 'position' properties.

For you as an instructor, IMHO, it'd be better to minimize the personal-preference-stuffs ^_^ try to be more focus about the course content.

*** keep on learning, keep on developing ***
